## El() function

Creates a computed property for  or 

<b>Signature:</b>

```typescript
declare function El(selector?: string, multiple?: boolean): TypedPropertyDecorator<any, any, string | number | symbol>;
```

## Parameters

|  Parameter | Type | Description |
|  --- | --- | --- |
|  selector | <code>string</code> | The css selector to pass to  or  |
|  multiple | <code>boolean</code> | If  should be used |

<b>Returns:</b>

`TypedPropertyDecorator<any, any, string | number | symbol>`

## Remarks

Preferably use [Ref()](./vue-extra-decorators.ref.md)

## Example


```typescript
@Component({ template: `<div><div id="foo"></div></div>` })
export default class FooBar extends Vue {
  @El("#foo") private foo!: HTMLDivElement;
}

```
